resources.string: Your account has been successfully registered. To complete the process please check your email for a validation request.
How will you use the app?
Please wait, while we validate your credentials.
The password must be at least 6 characters
You must complete all the fields
Registered user, please check your e-mail.
Verify either the data or the type of user
" An emergency situation was detected on the patient's ECG."
Place the electrodes in the indicated position, and when you are ready, begin the analysis.
" Your heart rate is below the defined normal range, you could be suffering from bradycardia. An SMS will be sent to your registered emergency contact."
" Your heart rate is within the range defined as normal."
" Your heart rate is above the range defined as normal, you could be having a tachycardia. An SMS will be sent to your registered emergency contact."
" Share your ID so a family member can monitor your heart rate in real time."
I share my ID with you so you can monitor my heart rate in real time.
" How to take my heart rate measurement with the vest?"
How to take my heart rate measurement in the app?
Make sure your vest is tight, then connect the electrodes. Remember the red color is connected near the right shoulder, the yellow color near the left shoulder and the green color near the right rib.

Remember that to take a heart rate measurement you must have the Heart Rate Monitor vest. In the Measure option of the lower navigation menu, press the Connect button to establish the bluetooth connection between the vest and the app. Authorize the permissions to make the bluetooth connection. Press the Measure button and wait for the measurement to be taken. Press the button located in the lower right part. Ready, you can see your heart rate measurement result in your history.

Heart rate is one of the \"vital signs\" or important indicators of health in the human body. It measures the number of times per minute that the heart contracts or beats. The speed of the heartbeat varies as a result of physical activity, threats to safety, and emotional responses. The resting heart rate is what a person has when they are relaxed. After age 10, a person\'s heart rate should be between 60 and 100 beats per minute while at rest.
